Here's what I learned from @rlskoeser
> We want IIIF manifests and images that we can connect to existing metadata and transcriptions, display on a public site, and use with IIIF annotations to display, add, and edit transcriptions

She would like JTS to be credited somewhere in the metadata -- what field should that be?

images should be labeled recto and verso -- how to assign labels to images at ingest?

She doesn't know what of the NEH-funded images (or any of the images, for that matter) Marina wants for the PGP; perhaps someone might go over the image set with her?
Thank you for this information, @rlskoeser.  I'll be curious to hear Esmé's take on this.

marc_liberation.title: Determine how holdings with no items behave in Alma

comments.body:
In voyager, if there's a holding with no item we retrieve the order status. In Alma there will be an item on the holding. If there is a real barcode it's an item. If there's a "temporary" barcode it's provisional (e.g. on order).

Real barcodes all begin with 32101 and are codabar formatted. The others will have a prefix (the barcode will start with text).

comments.body:
[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/35362699/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/35362699)

Coverage decreased (-0.2%) to 81.846% when pulling **71e24d4a4e3669d45264aa7c77b82b50738667e1 on 871-api-estimate-hits** into **d2923fd010050b3acf04ce4de47e1727e9442bc4 on main**.

We have publishing profiles called "FTP Dump" (the full dump) and "Incremental Dump". To see them:
- click the gear
- click the hamberger with a star icon
- search for  and go to "publishing profiles"
- select "all" from dropdown

We can't schedule anything until January. At that point we're thinking we'll schedule it monthly.

configuration (click gears) - search for "integration profiles" to see webhook configuration.

We were going to try marc21 but we're not going to. leaving this here for posterity:

We are exporting in XML because binary marc has a length limit. 

Try the binary export to see what happens if a record is too large? No. Binary records aren't good.

There are some very large MARC records in our Alma right now. Here are the MMS IDs:

- 99222417706421 (102,439 bytes) (https://catalog.princeton.edu/catalog/627005 in Voyager -- So the bib record itself is quite small; there are just a lot of items, and Alma publishing adds a field for every item attached.)
- 9927882200521 (84,154 bytes)

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/35371433/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/35371433)

Coverage decreased (-4.7%) to 77.384% when pulling **1732bbdf7a530bc3ca0bc2a8f5598582b3749eef on alma** into **d2923fd010050b3acf04ce4de47e1727e9442bc4 on main**.

pulfalight.title: Generating MARC records from EAD component records/archival objects in Resource records
Generating collection-level MARC records from EADs/Resource records
Supporting Voyager records for ReCAP materials in <container> elements

comments.body: Please be aware that this was discussed during a meeting of the ArchivesSpace Working Group Meeting (held on 12/01/20), and that there were concerns relating to how ArchivesSpace Resource location codes can be inserted into Voyager MARC records.

@regineheberlein I apologize for being unavailable for the meeting earlier today. For my own clarification, did the questions regarding the ReCAP material in Voyager involve some feature support in ArchivesSpace? (i. e. are stakeholders requesting some pipeline between ArchivesSpace and Voyager to update the Voyager MARC records?)

@jrgriffiniii 
As I understand it, this relates to the following situation:

Because of the ways our systems interoperate (or not), items stored at ReCAP must have a Voyager item record. These item records are currently added to Voyager by staff manually.

With the cutover to ASpace and pulfalight, there is a desire to automate this workflow and have ASpace top_containers with ReCAP locations exported from ASpace and imported to Voyager.

The ReCAP locations we use are 
rcpph
rcppf
rcppl
rcpxc
rcpxg
rcpxm
rcpxr

We also use the off-site location anxb; it may need to be included also.
